intro: Fawcettia merrilliana, commonly known as the Hawaiian fawcettia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface. Fawcettia merrilliana is typically found in moist, shaded areas of the Hawaiian rainforests.
